en.acceptedStatusMsg: Your decree nisi application has been accepted
en.acceptedStatusDetails: A district judge will formally announce the decree nisi at a court hearing. This is the first stage of the decree ending your marriage.
en.acceptedStatusPanelDetails: You'll only be divorced when the second stage is complete and you have your decree absolute.
en.acceptedHearingMsg1: You can find more details about the date of the hearing and the orders that will be made (including costs orders) in your Entitlement to a decree ({{ entitlementToADecreeFileLink.fileType | upper }}).
en.acceptedHearingInfo: You donâ€™t need to come to the hearing unless you want to object to any of the court orders being made.
en.acceptedHearingMsg2: If you want to attend the hearing, you need to email the court before the hearing date. If you, or your husband, want to dispute a costs order, the court must receive a letter or email stating the reasons for doing so at least 14 days before the hearing date.
en.acceptedHearingMsgExtra: The details of the hearing are being processed and will be available shortly
